title: MUSIC GEN_MUS 175-0-21 Selected Topics in Music Literature for Non-Majors

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course develops listening and writing skills to consider how musical artists achieve the status of "icon" and the ways in which their music addresses gender, sexuality, race, and political affiliation. Throughout the quarter, we will consider how communities turn to musicians in service of their cultural, political, and affective needs through individual case studies of icons ranging from Richard Wagner to Whitney Houston. Class time will be spent discussing assigned listening and readings, listening as a group, and developing research and writing strategies toward a final term paper.
